result.execSummary:
All charges against Ricky L Perry in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ricky L Perry is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

State moves to dismiss as the defendant is deceased.  Court dismisses case.  Court orders case dismissed.  Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witnesses A & B/Tallys Tap and Eatery listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.
